head.title: Peekskill Newspaper Folds In Face of Competition

hedline.hl1: Peekskill Newspaper Folds In Face of Competition

abstract.p: Peekskill-Cortlandt Herald, unable to compete with Star, Gannett's weekly supplement to Journal News, ceases operations (S)

block.p: Unable to compete with a Gannett newspaper in northern Westchester, the 14-year-old Peekskill-Cortlandt Herald folded late last month.

''We found it very expensive to put out the kind of newspaper we wanted -- a stand-alone,'' said Cecil J. North Jr., president of Guide Communications in Brewster. ''We don't have the resources that a chain has.''
Unable to compete with a Gannett newspaper in northern Westchester, the 14-year-old Peekskill-Cortlandt Herald folded late last month.

''We found it very expensive to put out the kind of newspaper we wanted -- a stand-alone,'' said Cecil J. North Jr., president of Guide Communications in Brewster. ''We don't have the resources that a chain has.''

He said The Herald, a 30-something- page tabloid-format paper, which was published weekly, was unable to compete for advertisers and readers with Gannett's weekly supplement to The Journal News, The Star.
